docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The brain is equipped with a sophisticated barrier that keeps foreign substances in the blood like bacteria and toxins from reaching brain tissue. But this blood-brain barrier, as scientists call it, also keeps out potentially useful substances like drugs to treat cancer and AIDS.

headline.main: Getting Vital Drugs Into the Brain

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Company started taking orders for its new ''smokeless'' cigarette yesterday from distributors, supermarkets and discount chains in test markets, amid attacks by medical groups that want the product banned as a health nostrum.

headline.main: 'Smokeless' Cigarette Ready For Sales Tests Amid Fight

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Doctors can be opinionated and rigid, and they sometimes stubbornly cling to ideas long after medical research in some area has taken a new turn. They are, after all, mere humans. But many doctors also change their minds when new ideas emerge, admitting it is time to embrace new thinking.
